result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2023
result.name: David Laity
result.title: over all its a great keyboard
result.review: i loved the design and over all quality but the clicking sounds it makes when you type a key is kind of annoying but mostly you get used to it and now i kind of like the clicky sound but at first you will probably think its to loud also i like how the ramp up to the keyboard is magnetic instead of the usual attaching ones that break easily

result.review: Feels as if it is brand new. Even came with the stickers and everything you would get if you bought it brand new.

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
result.name: Jason
result.title: Its Razer
result.review: I love the product everything about it makes my gaming enjoyable

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
result.name: Danielle Lisso
result.title: LIKE New? How about NEW!
result.review: Amazing quality, and beyond amazing delivery time. Especially over a holiday weekend. I ordered this early Friday morning and was pleasantly surprised to receive it by Sunday. They seriously must have driven it right to my house it was that fast. Amazing price, amazing quality. Everything was in original packaging with plastic and instruction manual. Lights work and it sounds AMAZING. Very quiet, and comfortable keyboard. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. Thank you!

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2023
result.name: Amazon Customer
result.title: Software to Control RGB Lighting Sells Personal info & Data
result.review: Just got the keyboard. It looks good and functions fine, but when I went to download the Razer Synapse software to change the RGB lights, I read in their license agreement that Razer sells your personal information and data to third parties. And in case of a data breach at Razer, personal info and data could be accessed by bad actors. So I wonï¿½t be downloading it. Luckily there is open source software to change the RGB lighting.

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
result.name: Amazon Customer
result.title: This is keyboard does not support NKRO!
result.review: Rule #1 for "gaming" keyboards is N-Key Rollover.This means that there is not a max number of key inputs the keyboard can process at one time.I assumed being a Razer gaming keyboard that this would be standard.It is not.I returned within 48 hours of receiving.I should have read through the description in more detail.Other than that, the lights are pretty and it types nicely.Nonetheless, do not buy if you plan on gaming.

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
result.name: Clayton
result.title: Love it and I love Razer products but what in the world is this wrist rest?
result.review: It's a great keyboard but the wrist rest is completely pathetic.. If you need it DO NOT buy this. If you don't it really is a great keyboard.

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2022
result.name: Cstober
result.title: Keys were painted black, temporary fix
result.review: Ornata V3 X:I didn't realize I ordered this keyboard used. It was less than 10% off. It appeared "Like New" for a few weeks until paint started chipping off the WASD keys. I would have spent the $5 for brand new.Love the keyboard though. I much prefer it to the original V3 because it's quiet.

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2022
result.name: Nicholas Harrison
result.title: Simple to use

result.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2022
result.name: Oksana P
result.title: V2 version is much more comfortable - changed opinion - V3 is better :)
result.review: It has a bit lower profile compared to V2. Keys sound is louder a bit. Support bar is plastic and not comfortable. Space bar sounds a bit different. Looks cheaper in general.---Changed rating from 3 stars to 4.5-5 after almost 1 month use. It's VERY comfortable to type on. The only cons: spacebar sound differs from other keys and design of volume control looks a bit "cheap". But I got used to it and now it's my main driver. Do recommend 100%.
